item.description:
Hi all,
Please read more about this full event on the group Message Board.

Mira Nair's (Monsoon Wedding and Salaam Bombay!) new film is the highly acclaimed drama which depicts a family's struggles to retain their Indian heritage upon re-settling in New York City.
"Nair's movie, adapted from an equally wonderful 2003 novel by Jhumpa Lahiri, brims with intelligence, compassion and sensuous delight in the textures, sights and sounds of life"
The Chicago Tribune

Here is a complete review: http://www.oregonlive...

As Spring has sprung (well at least hopefully soon) I thought it would be best to begin to have our group's weekend events on nights instead of during the afternoon.

I've changed the restaurant to Pho Lemongrass which is only a short walk from the theater. I've made a reservation for 25 people and have expanded the number of RSVP's accordingly.

And as is the custom, I'll be holding a Meet-Up sign near the front row when the movie ends. Since Coolidge Corner tends to rush people out after a movie we will also organize in the alleyway/entrance outside the theater.

Tom
